alert.note: Alert for Meigs; Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 11:55PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of southeastern Meigs, central Washington, Pleasants, northwestern Calhoun, Ritchie, Wirt, Tyler, northwestern Roane, northern Jackson and Wood Counties through 1215 AM EST... At 1151 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers along a line extending from near Ravenswood northeast to Marietta, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Parkersburg, Marietta, Belpre, Harrisville, St. Marys, Elizabeth, Middlebourne, Grantsville, Forked Run State Park, Vienna, Ravenswood, Williamstown, Paden City, Sistersville, Pennsboro, Belmont, Sandyville, Mineralwells, Washington and North Bend State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 146 and 186. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 13. Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
